content.description: Traverse the juggy rail with the crux being a thin spot or two near the right side. Can be done in either direction and is conducive to doing laps if so inclined.
content.location: Located on the left (west) side of the corridor near the entrance.

content.description: Very smooth, clean splitter/lieback up a slightly overhanging face to a slab above. About 5.9, #726 in the Miramontes guide. Base is being taken over by a Juniper bush though still plenty of space for a pad at the moment.
content.location: At the western tip of the formation with The Real Hall of Horrors/Walking Mexican Down the Hall, visible along the trail to the LHMFP boulders.

content.description:
Traverse to the right, and up, the wall that is across from Walking Mexican Down the Hall.  Use the obvious lip below the diagonal chimney and the thin footholds on the face of the wall.  Top out after you pass the large hueco above the chimney.  The crux is probably the top-out.

You can downclimb by stemming from the top using the opposite wall, or by slithering down the chimney back to the start.

This one gets an R for the potential to pinball off of the opposite wall if the mantel to top out does not go as planned.
content.protection: Crash pad and a good spotter.
content.location: This climb is directly across from Walking Mexican Down the Hall and goes left to right.  The start is just beyond the end of Walking Mexican Down the Hall.  As you enter the Real Hall of Horrors, it will be on the right roughly 35 feet down the hall.
